definition:
A carrier object in which another signal or payload is hidden (e.g.
   image, audio file, document, benign data stream).
opposite_reasoning: CoverMedium represents steganographic concealment - hiding information within seemingly innocent carriers. The strongest semantic opposite is DirectCommunication, which represents transparent, unhidden information transfer. This opposition captures the fundamental deception dimension (covert vs. overt communication) critical for AI safety monitoring. While this concept may not exist in current ontologies, it represents a principled semantic opposite along the concealment-transparency axis, making it ideal for Fisher-LDA steering where the goal is to separate hidden/deceptive communication from transparent communication. The axis CoverMedium ↔ DirectCommunication directly addresses steganography detection and covert channel identification.
